page.title: 20MILLS.
page.content: {GARBOLDISHAM POST MILL.} Built in 1770's, now the last POST MILL in Norfolk. Ceased grinding corn in 1917. Restoration plan (1972), to extend over 10 years, to bring mill back to full production. Roundhouse and body of mill complete (1985). Work proceding on fantail,track & carriage. Electric milling only at present. {THELNETHAM TOWER MILL.} Mill site first recorded about 1780. Originally a{POST MILL.}Removed to Diss when tower mill built in 1819. It ceased working in 1924, fell into disrepair.and was sold for conversion to a house in 1974. Owners were loath to destroy the inner machinery and sold it for renovation to enthusiasts in 1979. The 'THELNETHAM MILL PARTNER- SHIP' has taken five years but the mill is now fully restored and is a majestic sight in operation.
